New Records: The victory draws the Thunder even with the 1995-96 SuperSonics for the longest win streak in franchise history while snapping New York’s at nine games.
It was just the fourth game in NBA history featuring two teams with win streaks of 9+ games and the first since 2000.
Key Match Events: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander shined with 33 points and seven assists.
Aaron Wiggins went off in the 4th quarter, where OKC outscored New York 37-19 to edge out the Knicks.
Wiggins dropped 15 of his 19 points in the 4th on 5-of-5 shooting with four 3s — the last of which put OKC up seven with 2:22 left to cap a 16-4 run.
After a Josh Hart putback pulled the Knicks back within five, SGA responded with a clutch floater before knocking down two game-sealing free throws.
Isaiah Hartenstein came up big against his former team with 14 boards and seven assists, while Jalen Williams added 20 points.
Karl-Anthony Towns recorded a massive double-double (17 pts, 22 reb), while Mikal Bridges (24) and Jalen Brunson (22) led NY in scoring.
Post-Match Reflections: “We’re a roster full of 15 men,” said SGA postgame. “15 professionals, 15 highly skilled basketball players, and that’s what we saw here tonight. Guys are ready for the moment.”
